# ARConfiguration.FrameSemantics

**Structure**

Types of optional frame features you can enable in your app.

## Declaration

```swift
struct FrameSemantics
```

## Discussion

A frame semantic represents 2D information that ARKit extracts from a frame.

## Creating a Feature

- **init(rawValue:)**: Creates a frame semantics feature.

## Tracking Bodies in 2D

- **bodyDetection**: An option that indicates that 2D body detection is enabled.

## Occluding Virtual Content with People

- **personSegmentation**: An option that indicates that people occlude your app’s virtual content.
- **personSegmentationWithDepth**: An option that indicates that people occlude your app’s virtual content depending on depth.

## Accessing Depth

- **sceneDepth**: An option that provides the distance from the device to real-world objects viewed through the camera.
- **smoothedSceneDepth**: An option that provides the distance from the device to real-world objects, averaged across several frames.

## Enabling frame features

- **frameSemantics**: The set of active semantics on the frame.
- **supportsFrameSemantics(_:)**: Checks whether a particular feature is supported.

## Conforms To

- BitwiseCopyable
- Equatable
- ExpressibleByArrayLiteral
- OptionSet
- RawRepresentable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
- SetAlgebra
